raw_comment: I noticed that between the 75th and 90th percentile, the chances of being admitted are lower than the national average. I wonder if this is due to the unfortunate middle ground they face, not poor enough for financial boosts, but not rich enough to buy your way in. As someone with a close family tie to an elite school, I know it is lucky that my chances of getting accepted are significantly boosted. I would name this graph,” Climbing the vines into Ivy League schools is easy for the rich”.
ace_sentences: I noticed a fact about the graph.
The fact is that between the 75th percentile and the 90th percentile the chances of being admitted are lower than the national average.
I wonder whether this fact is due to a middle ground.
People in this middle ground are not poor enough for financial boosts.
People in this middle ground are not rich enough to buy admission.
I have a close family tie to an elite school.
I know that this family tie is lucky for me.
I know that my chances of being accepted are significantly boosted because of this family tie.
I would name this graph as follows.
Climbing the vines into Ivy League schools is easy for rich people.
